{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontogenic cysts are commonly treated with surgical procedures. According to Document [5], odontogenic cysts are managed with enucleation or marsupialization procedures. Document [12] also mentions that treatment for dentigerous cysts, a type of odontogenic cyst, is the extraction of the associated tooth followed by curettage and enucleation. Document [14] states that most cysts were treated with enucleation. Document [11] also mentions that the conservative enucleation is the treatment of choice for most odontogenic cysts. Therefore, it can be concluded that enucleation is the most frequently indicated surgical procedure for odontogenic cysts.", "answer_choice": "D. Enucleation"}
